bill_title: to prohibit local units of government from placing additional weight restrictions on certain commercial motor vehicles operating between a municipality and a state highway and to place certain restrictions on the use of such commercial vehicles.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit local units of government from placing additional weight restrictions on certain commercial motor vehicles operating between a municipality and a state highway and to place certain restrictions on the use of such commercial vehicles. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Notwithstanding the provisions of § § 32-14-6, 32-14-7, 32-22-24, and 32-22-25, no local unit of government may reduce the legal limits imposed pursuant to § 32-22-16 or 32- 22-21 on any motor vehicle licensed pursuant to chapter 32-9 or 32-10 on any highway which is under its jurisdiction and which provides the most direct route between a municipality and the state trunk highway system. No commercial vehicle operating on such a route from February fifteenth to April thirtieth, inclusive, may exceed thirty miles per hour. Any violation of this speed limit is a Class 2 misdemeanor. Any fine for a violation of the maximum limit set by § 32-22-16 or 32-22-21 by a commercial vehicle on such a route from February fifteenth to April thirtieth shall be three times the usual fine for such an overweight vehicle. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit local units of government from placing additional weight restrictions on certain commercial motor vehicles operating between a municipality and a state highway and to place certain restrictions on the use of such commercial vehicles. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Notwithstanding the provisions of § § 32-14-6, 32-14-7, 32-22-24, and 32-22-25, no local unit of government may reduce the legal limits imposed pursuant to § 32-22-16 or 32- 22-21 on any motor vehicle licensed pursuant to chapter 32-9 or 32-10 on any highway which is under its jurisdiction and which provides a direct route between a municipality and the state trunk highway system. No commercial vehicle operating on such a route from February fifteenth to April thirtieth, inclusive, may exceed thirty miles per hour. Any violation of this speed limit is a Class 2 misdemeanor. Any fine for a violation of the maximum limit set by § 32-22-16 or 32-22-21 by a commercial vehicle on such a route from February fifteenth to April thirtieth shall be three times the usual fine for such an overweight vehicle. BILL HISTORY 1/17/98 First read in House and referred to Transportation. H.J. 67 1/21/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/21/98 Transportation Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 7, NAYS 6. H.J. 141
